meanings.definition: Laughed nervously or in a restrained manner.
meanings.sent1: She tittered softly when the teacher made a joke.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends tittered at the silly movie.
meanings.sent3: During the serious meeting, he tittered at inappropriate times.
meanings.sent4: Her tittered response revealed her discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The tittered giggles filled the room with a light-hearted atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Made a series of short, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: The birds tittered in the trees at dawn.
meanings.sent2: Children tittered with excitement as they played together.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tittered as it scurried up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The wind tittered through the leaves, creating a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The audience tittered in anticipation of the performance.
